Description: Typical range for industrial Nd:YAG laser cleaners on reflective metals like Rhodium to balance efficiency and avoid thermal damage; recommended starting at 150W for contamination removal. Rhodium's high reflectivity (~65% at 1064 nm) requires higher power than less reflective substrates. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and studies on PGM cleaning (e.g., Opt. Lasers Eng. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Rhodium's moderate reflectivity and thermal absorption
Optimal beam diameter for precision cleaning resolution
High repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of contaminants
Scanning speed for efficient area coverage
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning results
